channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: 1 dead, 2 injured in shooting at Dallas ICE detention facility
item.description: One immigration detainee was killed and two are in critical condition after a shooting at the Dallas Immigration and Customs Enforcement field office Wednesday.

item.title: Trump blames Dallas ICE shooting on 'radical leftists'
item.description: President Trump blamed the Dallas ICE facility shooting on "radical leftists." Juliette Kayyem, a former Homeland Security official, talks about whether the evidence support his claim.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The latest on a deadly shooting at a Texas ICE detention facility, Ukraine warns Russia's war will spread unless ceasefire is forced, Democrats fight for ACA subsidies as government shutdown looms.

item.title: Photographer Sally Mann warns of 'new era of culture wars' after art seizure
item.description: As she reflects on her career in a second memoir, Sally Mann warns of a "new era of culture wars" after police pulled several photographs she took of her children decades ago off the walls of a museum.

item.title: Syria's leader makes debut on the world stage at UNGA
item.description: For the first time in decades, a Syrian leader addressed the U.N. General Assembly. A look at how the former rebel leader transformed himself into a global statesman.

item.title: 'It's really scary': Mississippi raises alarm as infant mortality rate rises
item.description: Officials in Mississippi recently declared a public health emergency after infant mortality rates in the state rose. Doctors and women on the front lines of the crisis discuss the obstacles they face.

item.title: Super typhoon batters southern China, causing blackouts and flooding
item.description: Typhoon Ragasa slammed into southern China Wednesday, unleashing 150 miles per hour wind gusts and torrential rain.

item.title: Ukraine says Russia's war will spread unless they're forced into ceasefire
item.description: Ukraine warns that Russia's war will spread unless the Kremlin is forced into a durable ceasefire.

item.title: Former Ukrainian ambassador talks about Trump's perceived pivot on Ukraine-Russia war
item.description: NPR speaks with William Taylor, the former U.S. ambassador to Ukraine, about President Trump saying the country could win back land taken by Russia.

item.title: Experts say Trump's guidance on hepatitis B vaccine and babies is dangerous
item.description: In a press conference this week, President Trump said there's no reason to give babies the Hepatitis B vaccine. But pediatricians and infectious disease experts say this guidance is dangerous.
